item.title: Jason add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I say, beware of all enterprises that require new clothes, and not rather a new wearer of clothes." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jason add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "True strength lies in submission which permits one to dedicate his life, through devotion, to something beyond himself." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Jason add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "An individual has not started living until he can rise above the narrow confines of his individualistic concerns to the broader concerns of all humanity." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jason add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "No human race is superior; no religious faith is inferior. All collective judgments are wrong. Only racists make them" -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Jason add a quote by Peter Maurin
item.description: "Modern society calls the beggar bum and panhandler and gives him the bum's rush. But the Greeks used to say that people in need are the ambassadors of the gods" -- Peter Maurin

item.title: Jason add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Jason add a quote by Miguel de Unamuno
item.description: "If a person never contradicts himself, it must be that he says nothing." -- Miguel de Unamuno

item.title: Jason add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace." -- John Lennon

item.title: Jason add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "There is nothing more truly artistic than to love people." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Jason add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "I hate quotations. Tell me what you know." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jason add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "For to be free is not merely to cast off one's chains, but to live in a way that respects and enhances the freedom of others." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Jason add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Nobody owns life, but anyone who can pick up a frying pan owns death." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Jason add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "The essential is never to arrive anywhere, never to be anywhere. The essential is to go on squirming forever at the edge of the line, as long as there are waters and banks and ravening in heaven a sporting God to plague his creature, per pro his chosen shits. I've swallowed three hooks and am still hungry. Hence the howls. What a joy to know where one is, and where one will stay, without being there. Nothing to do but strech out comfortably on the rack, in the blissful knowledge you are nobody for eternity." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Jason add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jason add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "I believe in evolution, scientific inquiry, and global warming; I believe in free speech, whether politically correct or politically incorrect, and I am suspicious of using government to impose anybody's religious beliefs -including my own- on nonbelievers." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Jason add a quote by Gerard Donovan
item.description: "The only test, Baker, is how not to erase ourselves from the map. Our history is that things don't last. Every generation creates the right monsters to destroy itself." -- Gerard Donovan

item.title: Jason add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Art is never finished, only abandoned." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Jason add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "A good writer possesses not only his own spirit but also the spirit of his friends." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Jason add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "It is the preoccupation with possessions, more than anything else that prevents us from living freely and nobly." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Jason add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Everything we shut our eyes to, everything we run away from, everything we deny, denigrate, or despise, serves to defeat us in the end." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Jason add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I like your Christ, I do not like your Christians. Your Christians are so unlike your Christ." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jason add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "The greatest hazard of all, losing one’s self, can occur very quietly in the world, as if it were nothing at all. No other loss can occur so quietly; any other loss - an arm, a leg, five dollars, a wife, etc. - is sure to be noticed." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Jason add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Spiritually, a man's thoughts must be the building in which he lives, otherwise it's wrong." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Jason add a quote by Dorothy Day
item.description: "The greatest challenge of the day is: how to bring about a revolution of the heart, a revolution which has to start with each one of us?" -- Dorothy Day

item.title: Jason add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jason add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one's head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no tomorrow. To forget time, to forgive life, to be at peace." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jason add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Jason add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jason add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Should I kill myself, or have a cup of coffee?" -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jason add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "We're all going to die, all of us, what a circus! That alone should make us love each other but it doesn't. We are terrorized and flattened by trivialities, we are eaten up by nothing." -- Charles Bukowski
